lines.content: Able to add to or remove from a list of tasks.
Able to mark a task as done or not done
Able to display a list of current Tasks
Able to find tasks with description matching a specified keyword
Able to save and load tasks such that memory of list of tasks is maintained between different application session
### `todo` - Adds a todo Task to the list
Creates new todo Task to be added and displays the Task added
A confirmation that the Task has been added and a description of it followed by total number of tasks
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
### `deadline` - Adds a deadline Task to the list
Creates new deadline Task to be added and displays the Task added
A confirmation that the Task has been added and a description of it followed by total number of tasks
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
### `event` - Adds an event Task to the list
Creates new event Task to be added and displays the Task added
A confirmation that the Task has been added and a description of it followed by total number of tasks
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
### `list` - Lists all the tasks that are in the list
List out all the details of the tasks that have been added
Here are the tasks in your list:
### `mark` - mark a specified task as done
Marks a task as done according to the specified index in the list
A confirmation that the Task has been marked and a description of it
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
### `unmark` - mark a specified task as done
Marks a task as not done according to the specified index in the list
A confirmation that the Task has been marked and a description of it
Nice! I've marked this task as not done yet:
Delete a Task according to the specified index in the list
A confirmation that the Task has been deleted and a description of it followed by total number of tasks
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Find the tasks with description which matches the specified keyword
A list of tasks matching with the keyword
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
* Subclass of Command to handle adding of tasks
* Initialises an AddCommand with the TaskList to be added onto and user input to be processed
* @param taskList list of tasks to be added onto
* @param userInput user input to be processed
* Add the new Task into the existing list and output result to user
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + (taskList.getTaskCount()) + " tasks in the list.");
* Processes the user input to determine what type of task is to be added
* @param userInput string of task described by user
* @return Task to be added to the list of tasks
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The description of a deadline cannot be empty.");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The description of an event cannot be empty.");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
* Check for empty description of Task to be added
* @param description description of Task to be checked
public static void checkEmptyDescription(String description) throws EmptyDescriptionException{
* Subclass of Command to handle exit from application
* Abstract parent class for all types of commands
// The Command class as well as all of its subclasses was created with reference to
* Abstract method for all child classes to implement
* Subclass of Command to handle deleting of tasks
* Initialises a DeleteCommand with the TaskList to be deleted from and index of Task to be deleted
* @param taskList list of tasks to be deleted from
* @param taskIndex index of Task to be deleted
* Delete the specified Task and output the result to user
System.out.println("Now you have " + taskList.getTaskCount() + " tasks in the list.");
System.out.println("Please use numbers only to specify task!");
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* Subclass of Command to handle listing of all tasks
* Initialises a ListCommand with the TaskList to be listed
* @param taskList list of tasks to be listed
* List out the tasks in the TaskList
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Subclass of Command to handle marking of tasks as done
* Initialises a MarkCommand with the TaskList and index of Task to be marked
* @param taskList list of tasks to be marked from
* @param taskIndex index of Task to be marked as done
* Mark the specified Task as done
System.out.println("Please use numbers only to specify task!");
* Subclass of Command to handle marking of tasks as not done
* Initialises a UnmarkCommand with the TaskList and index of Task to be unmarked
* @param taskList list of tasks to be unmarked from
* @param taskIndex index of Task to be marked as not done
* Mark the specified Task as not done
System.out.println("Please use numbers only to specify task!");
* Create new Deadline task with specification of whether it is done
* @param isDone status of completion for Deadline task
* Interprets the user input and formats the specified deadline into description accordingly
* @param task description of task with the details of deadline
* Initialises the file directory, and objects required for Duke
/** File and directory path of where data file is to be stored. */
private static TaskList taskList = new TaskList();
public static Ui ui = new Ui();
public static Storage storage = new Storage(FILE_PATH, DIRECTORY_PATH, taskList);
/** Do while loop to ask for user input */

* Create new Event task with specification of whether it is done
* @param isDone status of completion for Event task
* Interprets the user input and formats the specified event date into description accordingly
* @param task description of task with the details of event
* Parse user input and translate into suitable commands
* parse user input to be returned with suitable command
* @param userInput string that user has input to interact with application
* @param taskList TaskList object which maintains the list of tasks in the application
public Command parseCommand(String userInput, TaskList taskList){
* Handles the saving and loading of tasks
* @param directoryPath where the file is going to be stored
* @param taskList list of tasks in current session of application
public Storage(String filePath, String directoryPath, TaskList taskList){
* Loads the list of tasks into application from saved file, and creates a new file if no file is found
File file = new File(filePath); // create a File for the given file path
Scanner scanner = new Scanner(file); // create a Scanner using the File as the source
* Reads a line from the saved file and uses it to load the list of tasks
* @param taskDetails line from saved file which specifies the task to be loaded
* Creates a new file for data to be stored into
System.out.println("Oops.. something went wrong with creating the file.");
* Translates each task in the current list of tasks into individual strings to be written into data file
* Formats the task details such that it is easy for reading from the file when loading
formattedDesc = description.substring(0,startOfDate) + "/" + description.substring(startOfDate+1, startOfDate+3) + description.substring(startOfDate+4, endOfDate);
* Parent class of all kinds of tasks
*  Creates new task with specified description. Used as super constructor.
* Overloaded constructor with additional specification of whether task is completed
* @param isDone status of completion of task
* Generates status icon of task based on whether it is done
return (isDone ? "[X] " : "[ ] "); // mark done task with X
* Getter of status of completion of task
* @return whether task is done or not
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
* Represents the list of tasks created by user
* Add a new Task into the ArrayList of tasks
* @param task new Task to be added
* Delete a Task in the current ArrayList of tasks
* @param taskIndex index of Task to be deleted
* Create new Todo task with specification of whether it is done
* @param isDone status of completion for Todo task
* Handles UI that is shown to user
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
* Shows goodbye message to user before termination of application
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
